content.question: A researcher wants to examine how much information from waking life ends up in dreams. The researcher recruits 40 volunteers from a local community college to record the details of their daily activities. The participants will be given a sleep monitor that gently wakes them each time they end an REM cycle, after which they will complete a detailed dream diary. The study is planned to last for two weeks. Why would an institutional review board be hesitant to approve this study?

choices.label: This type of research should be done with animal subjects.
The researchers are disrupting sleep for an extended period, which may cause harm.
The researchers would not be able to hide the identities of the participants.
The researchers would be using deception without debriefing.

content.answer: The researchers are disrupting sleep for an extended period, which may cause harm.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
